answers.answer: I would see a good foot doctor.  I have some numbness in my foot and they ran a bunch of tests and discovered I have early onset diabetes.  However, there could be other problems causing this -- you could have a pinched nerve somewhere in the foot or ankle, or a disorder of one of the nerves in the feet.  One test the doc said you can do -- if you push on the foot you will see it turn white.  If it turns pink again fairly quickly, it means you still have blood flow in the area - which is a good sign.  If it doesn't return quickly, it could be more serious.

question: MY FOOT FEELS COLD LIKE A CORSPEBUT IT IS ONLY ON THE TOP RIGHT OF THE RIGHT FOOTI AM NOT SURE IF THAT IS NUMBNESSFOR ABOUT 5 DAYS NOWSHOULD I WORRY?
title: NUMBNES ON THE TOP RIGHT OF MY RIGH FOOT
